DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of the system sending the data
DataItem.DataItemNote: The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the EUROCONTROL Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix).

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of the service provided to one or more users.
DataItem.DataItemNote: the service identification is allocated by the system

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of a track
DataItem.DataItemNote: This Item shall be present in every ASTERIX record

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.
Absolute time stamping of the information provided in the track message, in the form of elapsed time since last midnight, expressed as UTC.
DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. This is the time of the track state vector. 2. The time is reset to zero at every midnight.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Status of a track.

Bits.BitsValue: SPI present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data

Bits.BitsName: Source of calculated track altitude for I062/130

Bits.BitsValue: last message transmitted to the user for the track
first message transmitted to the user for the track
ADS-B data inconsistent with other surveillance information
track not resulting from amalgamation process
Military Emergency present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data
Military Identification present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data
Age of the last received track update is higher than system dependent threshold (coasting)
Age of the last received PSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received SSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received Mode S track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received ADS-B track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Special Used Code (Mode A codes to be defined in the system to mark a track with special interest)
Assigned Mode A Code Conflict (same discrete Mode A Code assigned to another track)
Track created / updated with FPL data
Duplicate Flight Plan due to manual correlation

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. Track type and coasting can also be derived from I062/290 System Track Update Ages 2. If the system supports the technology, default value (0) means that the technology was used to produce the report 3. If the system does not support the technology, default value is meaningless.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated position in Cartesian co-ordinates with a resolution of 0.5m, in two’s complement form.
Calculated Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates with a resolution of 180/225. degrees

Bits.BitsName: Latitude in WGS.84 in twos complement. Range -90 < latitude < 90 deg.
Longitude in WGS.84 in twos complement. Range -180 < longitude < 180 deg.

DataItem.DataItemNote: The LSB provides a resolution at least better than 0.6m

DataItem.DataItemName: Mode 5 Data reports and Extended Mode 1 Code
DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode 5 Data reports and Extended Mode 1 Code

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of one octet, followed by the indicated subfields.

Bits.BitsName: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation
Time Offset for POS and GA.

Bits.BitsValue: No authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report (i.e any valid Mode 5 reply type other than ID)
Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C altitude not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C altitude from Mode 5 reply

Bits.BitsName: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report.
Bits.BitsValue: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received.

Bits.BitsName: Latitude in WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ latitude ≤ 90 deg.
Longitude in WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ longitude < 180 deg.
Resolution with which the GNSS-derived Altitude (GA) is reported.
GNSS-derived Altitude of target, expressed as height above WGS 84 ellipsoid.
Extended Mode 1 Code in octal representation

Time Offset coded as a twos complement number with an LSB of 1/128 s. The time at which the Mode 5 Reported Position (Subfield #3) and Mode 5 GNSSderived Altitude (Subfield #4) are valid is given by Time of Day (I048/140) plus Time Offset.
X-pulse from Mode 5 Data reply or Report.
Bits.BitsValue: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received.
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 3/A reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 2 reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 1 reply

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Mode 2 code associated to the track

DataItemFormat.desc: Two-Octet fixed length data item

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Vertical distance between the target and the projection of its position on the earth’s ellipsoid, as defined by WGS84, in two’s complement form.

DataItemFormat.desc: Two-Octet fixed length data item

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO 2. The source of altitude is identified in bits (SRC) of item I062/080 Track Status

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated Barometric Altitude of the track, in two’s complement form.

DataItemFormat.desc: Two-Octet fixed length data item

DataItem.DataItemNote: ICAO specifies a range between –10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Last valid and credible flight level used to update the track, in two’s complement form,.

DataItemFormat.desc: Two-Octet fixed length data item

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The criteria to determine the credibility of the flight level are Tracker dependent. 2. Credible means: within reasonable range of change with respect to the previous detection. 3. ICAO specifies a range between –10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C 4. This item includes the barometric altitude received from ADS-B

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated track velocity expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates, in two’s complement form.

DataItemFormat.desc: Four-octet fixed length Data Item .

DataItem.DataItemNote: The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the track.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated Mode of Movement of a track.

DataItemFormat.desc: One-Octet fixed length data item.

DataItem.DataItemNote: The ADF, if set, indicates that a difference has been detected in the altitude information derived from radar as compared to other technologies (such as ADS-B).

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated Acceleration of the target expressed in Cartesian coordinates, in two’s complement form.

DataItemFormat.desc: Two-octet fixed length Data Item .

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the track. 2. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Calculated rate of Climb/Descent of an aircraft in two’s complement form.

DataItemFormat.desc: Two-octet fixed length Data Item .

DataItem.DataItemNote: A positive value indicates a climb, whereas a negative value indicates a descent.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters.

DataItemFormat.desc: Seven-octet fixed length Data Item.

Bits.BitsValue: Callsign or registration downlinked from target

Bits.BitsName: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining target identification

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. For coding, see section 3.8.2.9 of [Ref.3] 2. As the Callsign of the target can already be transmitted (thanks to I062/380 Subfield #25 if downlinked from the aircraft or thanks to I062/390 Subfield #2 if the target is correlated to a flight plan), and in order to avoid confusion at end user’s side, this item SHALL not be used.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Target size defined as length and width of the detected target, and orientation.

DataItemFormat.desc: Variable length Data Item comprising a first part of one octet, followed by one-octet extents as necessary.

DataItem.DataItemNote: 1. The orientation gives the direction which the target nose is pointing to, relative to the Geographical North. 2. When the length only is sent, the largest dimension is provided.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Ages of the last plot/local track/target report update for eachsensor type.

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of up to two octets, followed by the indicated subfields.

Bits.BitsName: Actual track age since first occurence
Age of the last primary detection used to update the track
Age of the last secondary detection used to update the track
Age of the last Mode S detection used to update the track
Age of the last ADS-C report used to update the track
Age of the last 1090 Extended Squitter ADS-B report used to update the track
Age of the last VDL Mode 4 ADS-B report used to update the track
Age of the last UAT ADS-B report used to update the track
Age of the last magnetic loop detection
Age of the last MLT detection

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Ages of the data provided.

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of up to five octets, followed by the indicated subfields.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Vehicle fleet identification number.

DataItemFormat.desc: One octet fixed length Data Item.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: All measured data related to the last report used to update the track

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of one octet, followed by up to six subfields.

Bits.BitsValue: MODE 3/A code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Smoothed MODE 3/A code as provided by a sensor local tracker.

Bits.BitsName: Mode 3/A reply under the form of 4 digits in octal representation

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Data derived directly by the aircraft

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of up to four octets, followed by the indicated subfields

Bits.BitsName: Communications / ACAS Capability and Flight Status

Bits.BitsValue: Trajectory Intent Data is available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not available for this aircraft
Trajectory Intent Data is not valid

Bits.BitsName: Latitude in WGS.84 in twos complement. Range -90 < Lat < 90 deg.
Longitude In WGS.84 in twos complement. Range -180 < longitude < 180 deg.

Bits.BitsValue: Comm. A and Comm. B capability
Comm. A, Comm. B and Uplink ELM
Comm. A, Comm. B, Uplink ELM and Downlink ELM
No alert, no SPI, aircraft airborne
No alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
No alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
Transponder Ground Bit not set or unknown
highly manoeuvrable (5g acceleration capability) and high speed (more than 400 knots cruise)

Bits.BitsName: Latitude in WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -90 ≤ Lat ≤ 90 deg.
Longitude in WGS.84 in two’s complement. Range -180 ≤ longitude < 180 deg.
56 bit message conveying Mode S B message data
Comm B data Buffer Store 1 Address
Comm B data Buffer Store 2 Address

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: All flight plan related information

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of two octets, followed by up to fourteen subfields.

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Overview of all important accuracies

DataItemFormat.desc: Compound Data Item, comprising a primary subfield of two octets, followed by up to eight subfields of predefined length.

Bits.BitsName: Estimated Accuracy Of Track Position Cartesian
Estimated Accuracy Of Track Position WGS-84
Estimated Accuracy Of Calculated Track Geometric Altitude
Estimated Accuracy Of Calculated Track Barometric Altitude
Estimated Accuracy Of Track Velocity Cartesian
Estimated Accuracy Of Rate Of Climb/Descent
Estimated accuracy i.e. standard deviation of the calculated position of an aircraft expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates
Estimated accuracy i.e. standard deviation of the calculated position of an aircraft expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates
Calculated Track Geometric Altitude Estimated accuracy
Calculated Track Barometric Altitude Estimated accuracy
Estimated Accuracy Of Track Velocity X_Cartesian
Estimated Accuracy Of Track Velocity Y_Cartesian

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Identification of a system track

DataItemFormat.desc: Extendible data item, comprising a first part of three octets (Master Track Number), followed by three-octet extents (Slave Tracks Numbers).

DataItem.DataItemDefinition: Sp Field

DataItemFormat.desc: Sp Field
